intro: Benthamiella chubutensis, commonly known as the Chubut lily, is a flowering plant native to the Patagonian region of Argentina. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its bulbs are fleshy and store water, aiding in survival during dry periods. Benthamiella chubutensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
